CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 23,24 In addition , the comparison of random terpolymers with different compositions to their parent polymers has been rarely explored ; 25 such studies are critical for understanding the compositional effect of random terpolymers on the device performance , in terms of charge generation , transport , and structural properties. The combination of the different electron - deficient units of pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DPP ) and thieno [ 3,4- c]pyrrole-4,6-dione ( TPD ) can be ideal for producing broad light absorption due to the large difference between their electron - withdrawing strengths. 19,22 In addition , both units have been successfully used in D-A copolymers to produce high - performance PSCs. 26-33 While electron - withdrawing TPD possesses a relatively simple , symmetric , and planar structure suitable for D-A copolymers in PSCs , DPP exhibits very strong electron - withdrawing effect due to the presence of electrondeficient lactam rings and strong π-π interactions. 19,34 Herein , we report a series of novel random poly[thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene-pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4dione-thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione]copolymers ( PBDTT- DPP - TPD ) based on one electron - rich unit , thienylsubstituted benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene ( BDTT ) , and two electron - deficient units , DPP and TPD , that have complementary and broad light absorption ranging from 400 to 900 nm. This is a much broader absorption than other reported random terpolymers , 23,24 endowing a great potential for improving the PSC performance and providing an ideal system for studying the compositional effect of the random terpolymers on the PSC performance. While the ratio of DPP to TPD influenced the optical behavior of the random terpolymers , the power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of the polymers showed a nonlinear compositional dependence from 2 to 6% . The best PCE value of 6.33% was obtained from the blend device of PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) , with a short - circuit current density ( J SC ) higher than 16 mA / cm^2. To understand the nonlinear compositional dependence of the PCE , the optical , electrical , and structural properties of these random terpolymers with different ratios of DPP to TPD were systematically investigated. stated , all of the chemicals were purchased from Aldrich and used as received . The weight - average molecular weight ( M w ) , number - average molecular weight ( M n ) , and polydispersity index ( PDI ) of P1- P7 were measured by SEC with o-dichlorobenzene as an eluent at 80 ° C. The characteristics of the polymers are summarized in Table 1. To determine the actual ratio between DPP and TPD in the random terpolymers , they were characterized by 1H NMR spectroscopy and elemental analysis. The 1H NMR spectra of the polymers are shown in Figure S1. The peak of the butyloctyl chains adjacent to the lactam N atom of DPP appeared around 4.09 ppm and the signal of the octyl chains adjacent to TPD appeared around 3.77 ppm.

Let's think step by step.

1. pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP)
2. thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD)
3. thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDTT)
4. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)
5. o-dichlorobenzene (used as an eluent in SEC)

These are the Material Name entities identified in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP)
2. thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD)
3. thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDTT)

These are the Material Name entities that clearly refer to materials mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 23,24 In addition , the comparison of random terpolymers with different compositions to their parent polymers has been rarely explored ; 25 such studies are critical for understanding the compositional effect of random terpolymers on the device performance , in terms of charge generation , transport , and structural properties. The combination of the different electron - deficient units of pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DPP ) and thieno [ 3,4- c]pyrrole-4,6-dione ( TPD ) can be ideal for producing broad light absorption due to the large difference between their electron - withdrawing strengths. 19,22 In addition , both units have been successfully used in D-A copolymers to produce high - performance PSCs. 26-33 While electron - withdrawing TPD possesses a relatively simple , symmetric , and planar structure suitable for D-A copolymers in PSCs , DPP exhibits very strong electron - withdrawing effect due to the presence of electrondeficient lactam rings and strong π-π interactions. 19,34 Herein , we report a series of novel random poly[thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene-pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4dione-thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione]copolymers ( PBDTT- DPP - TPD ) based on one electron - rich unit , thienylsubstituted benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene ( BDTT ) , and two electron - deficient units , DPP and TPD , that have complementary and broad light absorption ranging from 400 to 900 nm. This is a much broader absorption than other reported random terpolymers , 23,24 endowing a great potential for improving the PSC performance and providing an ideal system for studying the compositional effect of the random terpolymers on the PSC performance. While the ratio of DPP to TPD influenced the optical behavior of the random terpolymers , the power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of the polymers showed a nonlinear compositional dependence from 2 to 6% . The best PCE value of 6.33% was obtained from the blend device of PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) , with a short - circuit current density ( J SC ) higher than 16 mA / cm^2. To understand the nonlinear compositional dependence of the PCE , the optical , electrical , and structural properties of these random terpolymers with different ratios of DPP to TPD were systematically investigated. stated , all of the chemicals were purchased from Aldrich and used as received . The weight - average molecular weight ( M w ) , number - average molecular weight ( M n ) , and polydispersity index ( PDI ) of P1- P7 were measured by SEC with o-dichlorobenzene as an eluent at 80 ° C. The characteristics of the polymers are summarized in Table 1. To determine the actual ratio between DPP and TPD in the random terpolymers , they were characterized by 1H NMR spectroscopy and elemental analysis. The 1H NMR spectra of the polymers are shown in Figure S1. The peak of the butyloctyl chains adjacent to the lactam N atom of DPP appeared around 4.09 ppm and the signal of the octyl chains adjacent to TPD appeared around 3.77 ppm.

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDTT-DPP: This is a random copolymer consisting of three units: benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDTT), pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP), and thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD).
2. PC71BM: [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester is a fullerene derivative used as an electron acceptor in organic solar cells.
3. Aldrich: It is a chemical supplier from where all the chemicals were purchased.
4. Mw: Weight-average molecular weight of the polymers.
5. Mn: Number-average molecular weight of the polymers.
6. PDI: Polydispersity index of the polymers.
7. J SC: Short-circuit current density of the polymer-fullerene blend device.
8. DPP: Pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione is an electron-deficient unit in the copolymer.
9. TPD: Thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione is another electron-deficient unit in the copolymer.
10. BDTT: Benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene is an electron-rich unit in the copolymer.
11. o-dichlorobenzene: A solvent used for measuring the molecular weights of the polymers by SEC.
12. Table 1: A table summarizing the characteristics of the polymers.
13. Figure S1: A figure containing the 1H NMR spectra of the polymers.
14. 4.09 ppm: The chemical shift of the butyloctyl chains adjacent to the lactam N atom of DPP in the 1H NMR spectra.
15. 3.77 ppm: The chemical shift of the octyl chains adjacent to TPD in the 1H NMR spectra.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. Mw (weight-average molecular weight)
2. Mn (number-average molecular weight)
3. PDI (polydispersity index)
4. J SC (short-circuit current density)
5. DPP (pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione) - electron-deficient unit
6. TPD (thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione) - electron-deficient unit
7. BDTT (benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene) - electron-rich unit.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| weight-average molecular weight (Mw) |
| number-average molecular weight (Mn) |
| polydispersity index (PDI) |
| short-circuit current density (J SC) |
| pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP) |
| thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD) |
| benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDTT) |

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 23,24 In addition , the comparison of random terpolymers with different compositions to their parent polymers has been rarely explored ; 25 such studies are critical for understanding the compositional effect of random terpolymers on the device performance , in terms of charge generation , transport , and structural properties. The combination of the different electron - deficient units of pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DPP ) and thieno [ 3,4- c]pyrrole-4,6-dione ( TPD ) can be ideal for producing broad light absorption due to the large difference between their electron - withdrawing strengths. 19,22 In addition , both units have been successfully used in D-A copolymers to produce high - performance PSCs. 26-33 While electron - withdrawing TPD possesses a relatively simple , symmetric , and planar structure suitable for D-A copolymers in PSCs , DPP exhibits very strong electron - withdrawing effect due to the presence of electrondeficient lactam rings and strong π-π interactions. 19,34 Herein , we report a series of novel random poly[thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene-pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4dione-thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione]copolymers ( PBDTT- DPP - TPD ) based on one electron - rich unit , thienylsubstituted benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene ( BDTT ) , and two electron - deficient units , DPP and TPD , that have complementary and broad light absorption ranging from 400 to 900 nm. While the ratio of DPP to TPD influenced the optical behavior of the random terpolymers , the power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of the polymers showed a nonlinear compositional dependence from 2 to 6% . The best PCE value of 6.33% was obtained from the blend device of PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) , with a short - circuit current density ( J SC ) higher than 16 mA / cm^2. To understand the nonlinear compositional dependence of the PCE , the optical , electrical , and structural properties of these random terpolymers with different ratios of DPP to TPD were systematically investigated. stated , all of the chemicals were purchased from Aldrich and used as received . The weight - average molecular weight ( M w ) , number - average molecular weight ( M n ) , and polydispersity index ( PDI ) of P1- P7 were measured by SEC with o-dichlorobenzene as an eluent at 80 ° C. The characteristics of the polymers are summarized in Table 1. To determine the actual ratio between DPP and TPD in the random terpolymers , they were characterized by 1H NMR spectroscopy and elemental analysis. The 1H NMR spectra of the polymers are shown in Figure S1. The peak of the butyloctyl chains adjacent to the lactam N atom of DPP appeared around 4.09 ppm and the signal of the octyl chains adjacent to TPD appeared around 3.77 ppm.

Let's think step by step.

1. Molecular weights:
- P1 to P7: weight-average molecular weight (Mw), number-average molecular weight (Mn), and polydispersity index (PDI)

2. Electrical property:
- Power conversion efficiency (PCE)
- Short-circuit current density (J SC)

3. Optical property:
- Absorption ranging from 400 to 900 nm

4. Structural property:
- Electron-withdrawing strength of pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP) and thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD)

5. Ratio of DPP to TPD:
- Influences the optical behavior of the random terpolymers
- Shows a nonlinear compositional dependence on the PCE from 2 to 6%

6. Chemicals:
- All chemicals were purchased from Aldrich

7. SEC measurement:
- o-dichlorobenzene as an eluent at 80 °C

8. Characterization:
- 1H NMR spectroscopy and elemental analysis were used to determine the actual ratio between DPP and TPD in the random terpolymers.

9. 1H NMR spectroscopy:
- Peak of butyloctyl chains adjacent to the lactam N atom of DPP appeared around 4.09 ppm
- Signal of the octyl chains adjacent to TPD appeared around 3.77 ppm.

So, the values and units for the material properties are as follows:

1. Molecular weights: Mw (g/mol), Mn (g/mol), PDI (dimensionless)
2. Electrical property: PCE (%), J SC (mA/cm^2)
3. Optical property: Absorption (nm)
4. Structural property: Electron-withdrawing strength (unitless)
5. Ratio of DPP to TPD: Ratio (dimensionless)
6. SEC measurement: Mw (g/mol), Mn (g/mol), PDI (dimensionless)
7. Characterization: Peak position (ppm)

Note: The units for some properties are not explicitly mentioned in the text but can be inferred based on the context.

4. Structural property: Electron-withdrawing strength (unitless)

6. 1H NMR spectroscopy: Peak position (ppm)
